New Records: Nikola Jokic recorded his NBA-best fifth triple-double of the season.
Jamal Murray became the first player in Nuggets franchise history with 1,000 career 3-pointers.
Key Match Events: Nikola Jokic had 30 points, 14 assists, and 11 rebounds for his third straight triple-double.
Jamal Murray scored 28 points after missing the past three games in concussion protocol.
Jimmy Butler turned his ankle on a drive against Murray seven minutes into the game and did not return.
Tyler Herro had a team-high 24 points and 11 assists for the Heat.
The Nuggets outscored the Heat 15-4 in the opening 3:03 of the third quarter to extend their advantage to 86-64.
Russell Westbrook dished out a season-high 10 assists for Denver.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Denver raced out to a 17-6 lead in the opening 4:10 as part of a 40-point first quarter in which it made 14 of its 20 shots.
Miami never led and trailed by as many as 26 in the second half.
Miami's fourth loss in its past five games came with the added pain of losing Jimmy Butler.
Denver continued its recent surge, winning for the sixth time in the past seven games after an 0-2 start.
